definition.text: In order to manage contributions from within the app, you first need to provide your Github.com credentials so that we can get authenticated when pushing your changes to the remote repository. 2

paragraphs.text: Github Crendentials are Missing. Please solve this issue and try again.

At the root folder of Superalgos, you will need to create a JSON file called Github.json. Use simple text editor like notepad and configure there your Github credentials. You can copy and paste the following template, replacing the dummy strings with your actual user name and password.
repository: The URL of your Superalgos fork.
Don't worry, your crendentials will not be uploaded to the repository because the file Github.json is listed at the .gitignore file, so it will be ignored and will only be at your local computer.
The system will use your credentials only to execute a git push command pointing to your Superalgos repository fork, in order to upload all the changes you made to Docs Pages.
